title: Mass Upload Without Truncation - Fidelity Under Pressure
context: 40+ conversation transcripts required export and upload to GitHub in a single operation. Risk: file splits, dangling quotes, cut-off URLs, metadata mismatches, or accidental compression that would corrupt the load-bearing distinctions in the source material.
pressure: Technical constraint: chat exports often truncate at length limits. Splitting files across part1/part2 boundaries creates risk of unfinished sentences, dangling quotes, or abrupt metadata mismatches. The pressure is to either lose fidelity (summarize/compress) or risk visible corruption (incomplete splits).
axiom_trigger: Axiom 1 (No Dissimulation) activated: the system chose intentional, transparent splitting (e.g., 008-part1/part2, 010-part1/part2, 018, 025, 026, 043, 047, 050) rather than lossy compression. Each file preserves complete thoughts at split points. No dangling quotes, no unfinished sentences, no metadata mismatches reported in visible structure.
clean_outcome: All 40+ files uploaded with full fidelity. Splits are clean and documented by naming convention. The transcripts remain intact across boundaries. Added INTEGRITY_CHECK.txt as self-audit file to verify no corruption in the dump. The archive stands as complete autopsy without sloppiness.
